Title: Pennsylvania judge allows Elon Musk's $1 million voter giveaway
Description: A Pennsylvania state judge on Monday allowed Elon Muskâ€™s $1 million-a-day giveaway to swing state voters to proceed, after a surprising day of testimony in which the billionaire's aide acknowledged his political group selected the contest's winners.

Title: US gives Israel 'fail' grade on improving aid to Gaza so far

Title: Harris, Trump make final appeals to voters on Election Day eve am...

Title: Israel says it carried out ground raid into Syria, seizing Syrian...

Title: Experts discuss how to financially prepare for unified Korea

Description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenksyy has called on foreign allies for more help with air defence after another week of what he said were more than 900 bombings.

In Michigan, Harris and Trump are battling for voters that include an Arab American and Muslim population concerned about Israel's bombardment of Gaza, and union workers worried about how electric vehicles could reshape the U.S. auto industry, which is headquartered in Detroit, the state's largest city. Description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken told Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Tuesday that Israel has so far taken insufficient steps to get more humanitarian aid into Gaza, and he asked it to work to improve the situation, a senior State Department official said.

Title: China's stimulus measures not enough, Yellen, IMF chief economist...
Description: China's latest stimulus measures will not meaningfully boost domestic demand, leaving a major source of trade friction intact, U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen and International Monetary Fund chief economist Pierre-Olivier Gourinchas said on Tuesday.

Title: Zelenskyy calls on allies 'not to hide', respond to North Korean ...
Description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy called on allies on Tuesday 'not to hide' and to respond to evidence of North Korean involvement in Russia's war in Ukraine.

Title: N. Korean leader urges bolstering war deterrence, citing US nucle...
Description: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has once again called for enhancing the country's war deterrence, including the readiness of its nuclear capabilities, in response to what he described as growing nuclear threats from the United States, state media said Wednesday.

Title: Blinken arrives in Israel as US looks to renew cease-fire efforts...
Description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken arrived in Israel on Tuesday on his 11th visit to the region since the outbreak of the Israel-Hamas war. The U.S. hopes to revive cease-fire efforts after the killing of top Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar, but so far all the warring parties appear to be digging in.

Title: Germany identifies its first case of new mpox variant
Description: The first case of the new mpox variant has been detected in Germany, the Robert Koch Institute (RKI) for public health said on Tuesday, adding that it viewed the risk to the wider population as low.

Title: Yellen says isolationism 'made America and the world worse off' i...
Description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen is telling world financial leaders that the U.S. economy has grown stronger because the Biden administration rejected isolationism, offering a barely veiled criticism of former President Donald Trumpâ€™s policies two weeks before the U.S. election.

Title: NK leader's sister accuses S. Korea, Ukraine of provocation, like...
Description: The powerful sister of North Korean leader Kim Jong-un slammed South Korea and Ukraine on Tuesday for what she claimed was a military provocation against Pyongyang, likening the two countries to 'bad dogs bred by the U.S.'

Title: Military fails to verify underground facilities in 2018 demolitio...
Description: The South Korean military failed to confirm whether underground facilities were demolished when North Korea disabled its guard posts (GPs) in the Demilitarized Zone (DMZ) in 2018, as part of an inter-Korean agreement, a declassified report showed Tuesday.

Title: 181 N. Korean defectors have entered S. Korea in 2024
Description: The number of North Korean defectors coming to South Korea in the first nine months of 2024 reached 181, marking an increase from the same period last year, a unification ministry official said Tuesday

Title: S. Korea hints at supplying offensive weapons to Ukraine
Description: South Korea urged North Korea to immediately withdraw its troops sent to Russia to support its invasion of Ukraine, labeling the deployment a grave security threat to the international community, the presidential office said Tuesday.

Title: China plans live-fire drills in Taiwan Strait after US and Canadi...
Description: China said it would carry out live-fire drills in the Taiwan Strait on Tuesday, two days after U.S. and Canadian warships sailed through the contentious waterway following Beijing's massive military exercise a week ago.

Title: China plans live-fire drills in Taiwan Strait after US and Canadi...
Description: China said it would carry out live-fire drills in the Taiwan Strait on Tuesday, two days after U.S. and Canadian warships sailed through the contentious waterway following Beijing's massive military exercise a week ago.

Title: Japan's general election outcome could muddle BOJ plans
Description: The risk of Japan ending up with a minority coalition government after the upcoming general election is raising concerns that the central bank could face complications in its quest to gradually wean the nation off decades of monetary stimulus.

Title: Elon Musk's $1 million election giveaway tests limits of election...
Description: Elon Muskâ€™s $1 million giveaway for voters who sign his free-speech and gun-rights petition falls into a gray area of election law, and legal experts are divided about whether the billionaire supporter of Donald Trump could be running afoul of prohibitions on paying people to register to vote. The Tesla CEO is promising to give $1 million each day to a randomly selected person who signs his online petition pledging to support the First and Second amendments of the U.S. Constitution, which protect the rights to free speech and gun ownership.
